dialogue.string: s!�Give the physician orders.Commence healing, stat!Specify healing methods.Offer moral support.Rest and recover.Issue no orders.
1�Prescribe what type of treatment?Cures and physical healing.Status ailment recovery.
s!�Give the physician orders.Commence healing, stat!Specify healing methods.Offer moral support.Rest and recover.Issue no orders.
1�Prescribe what type of treatment?Cures and physical healing.Status ailment recovery.
s!�Give the physician orders.Commence healing, stat!Specify healing methods.Offer moral support.Rest and recover.Issue no orders.
1�Prescribe what type of treatment?Cures and physical healing.Status ailment recovery.
1�Leave the area?Yes.No.
1�Leave the area?Yes.No.
1�Leave the area?Yes.No.
1�Ah, you must be the volunteer that Master Caster Kayeel-Payeel mentioned.Thank you oh-so-much for helping-welping us out!
1�You see, the mission is sooo fraughtaru with danger, no one wanted to take part.But then you haplessly showed up at the most opportune timing!

1�Our objective is as straightaru-forward as a road without turns, wurns, bends, or wends.These caverns are thick with beastarumen, you see, and your task is to eliminate them! Biff! Bash! Kapowy-wowie!
1�But as we don'taru have all the time in the world, do keepy-weep an eye on the clock.As the saying goes, ??haste makes for great taste??! No, wait...
1�Ah, never-wever mind.I'll be following closely-wosely behind, so just give me a holler when you finish clearing the caverns of monstarus.
1�And without further ado, let the extermination-wation begin!Do well, clobber a tonz of monstarus, and a juicy reward might just be waiting for you!
1�Hm? I don't thinky-wink we're quite done yet.Bettaru get a move on, 'cause the clock's tick-tocking, wick-wocking away!
1�Wowsers-trousers! The caverns are squeaky-weaky clean of enemy presence!
1�Master Caster Kayeel-Payeel will surely hear of your splendifer-wiferous performance.
1�The objective isn't over until you reportaru back to base camp, so stay alerty-wert. Okay?
1�Ho there, soldier. You must be the extra pair of hands Chief Sturm sent word about.
1�No time for pleasantries, I'm afraid, so perk them ears up and pay attention to the briefing.
1�The Republic's task is the strategic blastin' of key locations in these caverns, and you're gonna be helpin' us out.
1�An assortment of our scout and engineer operatives--twenty-four in all--have already assumed positions and planted the explosive charges.

1�By detonatin' these charges, we weaken the structural integrity of the entire passageway, primin' it for the big one that'll send them filthy beastmen scurryin' back to their den. That is, if they don't get buried alive first. Hra hra hra!
1�But here's the rub. Simultaneously detonatin' all the charges would draw the enemy's attention and blow our cover.That's why we'll be doin' it bit by bit, one explosion after the next.
1�And this is where you come in, soldier. You'll be the fuse, so to speak.Huh? What's that supposed to mean, you ask? I was just gettin' to that.
1�First, I'll administer you with a special stimulant that'll boost your movement speed.But that's not its only function, mind you.
1�Approach an operative while the stimulant's still in effect.That's their cue to detonate their charge and then leave the caverns.
1�Report back to me when all twenty-four charges have been detonated and all operatives have safely evacuated.

1�There's one detail you oughta keep in mind. As a countermeasure against espionage, the stimulant's effect is designed to fade out after a time. But the benefits'll remain so long as you keep movin' and settin' off the charges.
1�If the stimulant wears off halfway, come back here by either talkin' to an operative or by usin' one of them ensigns.
1�Of course this means you'll have to start the mission over from the top.
1�What the hell's an ??ensign,?? you ask? See that thing behind you?That's an ensign. One of Republican persuasion, to be precise.
1�Six of these've been placed throughout the caverns to expedite our operatives' movement.They should come in handy if you're plannin' on doin' the mission as a group, as well as in emergencies.
1�Now, here's one last tip before I send you off.The instant a charge is detonated, run towards the blast. Beyond the explosion, you'll find your next man.
1�Now then, I'm gonna administer the stimulant.Report back to me after all twenty-four charges've been detonated and the operatives safely evacuated. The same goes for if you fail.
1�Are we good to go?
1�Good to go?Let's get it on!I wasn't paying attention...
1�The mission is commenced!Move it, move it, move it!
1�So...you failed. What will you do, soldier?
1�What would you like to do?I want wings to fly!Listen to briefing.Give up and go home.
1�The mission is commenced!Move it, move it, move it!
1�yYou will be transported from the area. Do you wish to procee
d?�Give up and leave the area?Not yet.Right away.
1�The Republic's task is the strategic blastin' of key locations in these caverns, and you're gonna be helpin' us out.
1�An assortment of our scout and engineer operatives--twenty-four in all--have already assumed positions and planted the explosive charges.

1�By detonatin' these charges, we weaken the structural integrity of the entire passageway, primin' it for the big one that'll send them filthy beastmen scurryin' back to their den. That is, if they don't get buried alive first. Hra hra hra!
1�But here's the rub. Simultaneously detonatin' all the charges would draw the enemy's attention and blow our cover.That's why we'll be doin' it bit by bit, one explosion after the next.
1�And this is where you come in, soldier. You'll be the fuse, so to speak.Huh? What's that supposed to mean, you ask? I was just gettin' to that.
1�First, I'll administer you with a special stimulant that'll boost your movement speed.But that's not its only function, mind you.
1�Approach an operative while the stimulant's still in effect.That's their cue to detonate their charge and then leave the caverns.
1�Report back to me when all twenty-four charges have been detonated and all operatives have safely evacuated.

1�There's one detail you oughta keep in mind. As a countermeasure against espionage, the stimulant's effect is designed to fade out after a time. But the benefits'll remain so long as you keep movin' and settin' off the charges.
1�If the stimulant wears off halfway, come back here by either talkin' to an operative or by usin' one of them ensigns.
1�Of course this means you'll have to start the mission over from the top.
1�What the hell's an ??ensign,?? you ask? See that thing behind you?That's an ensign. One of Republican persuasion, to be precise.
1�Six of these've been placed throughout the caverns to expedite our operatives' movement.They should come in handy if you're plannin' on doin' the mission as a group, as well as in emergencies.
1�Now, here's one last tip before I send you off.The instant a charge is detonated, run towards the blast. Beyond the explosion, you'll find your next man.
1�Now then, I'm gonna administer the stimulant.Report back to me after all twenty-four charges've been detonated and the operatives safely evacuated. The same goes for if you fail.
1�Are we good to go?
1�Are we good to go?Let's get it on!Listen to briefing.Give up and go home.
1�The mission is commenced!Move it, move it, move it!
1�yYou will be transported from the area. Do you wish to procee
d?�Give up and leave the area?Not yet.Right away.
1�Welcome back, soldier. The mission was a great success, thanks to you.Now all that's left to do is wait for the command to send everything crumblin' down.
1�Chief Sturm herself will be sure to hear of your exploits from me. You can count on it, soldier.
1�Be transported where?Republic Ensign I.Republic Ensign II.Republic Ensign III.Republic Ensign IV.Republic Ensign V.Republic Ensign VI.Nowhere.1���
